definition: to depend on/to comply with or listen to sb/according to/in the light of
next in sequence/second/the second (day, time etc)/secondary/vice-/sub-/infra-/inferior quality/substandard/order/sequence/hypo- (chemistry)/classifier for enumerated events: time

sentences.english: An incoming document may well come before each of them in turn.
sentences.chinese: 一份新到的文件可能要依次在每个人那儿都走一遍。

sentences.english: The ascending diatonic scale is the scale going up by step from lower to higher frequencies or pitches.
sentences.chinese: 上行自然音阶为依次由低到高上升的音。

sentences.english: The headmaster is calling off the names on his list.
sentences.chinese: 校长正在按名单依次唱名。

sentences.english: The practice is, arrive down nose ala zygomatic and labial edge is ordinal massage can.
sentences.chinese: 做法是，顺着鼻翼到颧骨以及唇边依次按摩即可。

sentences.english: You will receive the other numbers of China Reconstructs in course.
sentences.chinese: 你将依次收到《中国建设》其他各期。

sentences.english: We'll discuss each category in turn in the following sections.
sentences.chinese: 我们将在以下几部分中依次讨论每一种类别。

sentences.english: The program demonstrates the function of LED through GPIO configuration. LED will be flickering from left to right in turn.
sentences.chinese: 本例程演示了闪灯的功能，灯会依次从左向右闪烁。

sentences.english: Here we implement the three methods in turn.
sentences.chinese: 这样我们依次实现了三个方法。

sentences.english: In turn, this region secretes molecules that affect appetite.
sentences.chinese: 这一区域依次分泌分子影响食欲。

sentences.english: This, in turn, made different iconographic demands on painting.
sentences.chinese: 这就依次让肖像绘画有了不一样的需求。

sentences.english: Start from leftmost tree, and work your way up.
sentences.chinese: 从最左侧的树开始，按照顺序依次执行。

sentences.english: The columns are also numbered 1-5, and represent the same modules, respectively.
sentences.chinese: 列也依次编号为1至5，分别表示与行同样的模块。

sentences.english: Men, women and children are put on the family holiday attire, followed by the seated position in the family hierarchy.
sentences.chinese: 全家男女老少都穿上节日的盛装，按辈分依次坐定。

sentences.english: Amid deafening applause, people on the platform went ashore in succession.
sentences.chinese: 在震耳欲聋的鞭炮声中，试航人员依次上岸。

sentences.english: Please line up and take photos, then make your ID card with the form in your hand.
sentences.chinese: 请依次排队照相，然后拿着各人的登记表办理身份卡。

sentences.english: I'll discuss the details of each in turn.
sentences.chinese: 我将依次讨论每一个模型的细节。

definition: to part or leave each other/to distinguish/difference/in different ways/differently/separately or individually
to divide into rows/to identify subcategories/to break down into constituent parts/breakdown/disaggregation
and so on/in a similar fashion
to stand side by side/to be juxtaposed
to follow closely behind sb or sth (idiom)
to divide (into)/to split a bonus/to break into/tenths/percentage allotment
